subject: Re: Difference between $ and $$ in function defn
body:
This is the prototype for the subroutine.  $$ indicates it takes two
scalars as arguments, and $ indicates it takes one.

-Jason

On 4/11/07, Nath, Alok (STSD)  wrote:
> Hi,
>         What is the difference between this two function defs ?
>         When there is $ and $$      ??
>
>         sub test($$){
>                 ...
>         }
>
>         sub test($){
>                 ...
>         }
>
> Thanks
> Ak
>
> --
